snippet: The journal of Alfred Rosenberg, dating from 1936 through 1944, was lost but never forgotten, and federal investigators have tracked it down.
abstract: Pages from diary of chief Hitler aide Alfred Rosenberg, missing since conclusion of Nuremberg trials, are briefly displayed for first time by the federal investigators who helped recover them; diary is likely to offer new insights into decision to exterminate Jews, infighting among Nazi officials and plunder of Europe's art.
lead_paragraph: The journal of Alfred Rosenberg, dating from 1936 through 1944, was lost but never forgotten, and federal investigators have tracked it down.

headline.main: Diary of a Hitler Aide Resurfaces After a Hunt That Lasted Years
headline.print_headline: Diary of a Hitler Aide Resurfaces After a Hunt That Lasted Years

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
